contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Korean name| hangul=환인| hanja=桓因| mr=Hwan-in| rr=Hwan-in| }} '''Hwanin''', (also pronounced "Han-in" 한인) or "Divine Regent" is a figure in [[Korean mythology]]. In the traditional Dangun mythology he is portrayed as the Emperor of Heaven himself, with his son [[Hwanung]] 환웅(桓雄) and his grandson [[Dangun]] being the mythical founder of Korea. Hwanin 환인(桓因) is the name on [[Buddhism]] of [[Indra]], this name is widely used in east Asia. ==See also== * [[Culture of Korea]] * [[History of Korea]] * [[List of Korea-related topics]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Asia-myth-stub}} [[Category:Gods]] [[Category:Korean mythology]]
